arts.ttl: Abraham’s nightmare cameo: Milan striker’s brief appearance ends in missed chance and Injury
arts.sum: In a dramatic turn of events during AC Milan’s match against Udinese at San Siro, English striker Tammy Abraham experienced a rollercoaster five-minute appearance that encapsulated the cruelty of football. Calciomercato detail how Abraham, who had been left out of the starting lineup following a penalty miss in the previous match against Fiorentina, was introduced as a substitute in the 73rd minute. Manager Paulo Fonseca brought him on to replace a tired Alvaro Morata, with Milan down to ten men since the 29th minute due to Tijjani Reijnder’s red card. arts.ttl: Udinese fans target Maignan with abusive chants following racism Incident
arts.sum: In a Milan-Udinese match filled with emotions and controversial refereeing decisions, Udinese fans in the away section engaged in intimidating behavior towards AC Milan goalkeeper Mike Maignan. The French keeper was the target of several chants throughout the second half, including offensive phrases, as he defended the goal directly in front of the Udinese supporters. Calciomercato report how this incident follows a previous racism controversy from last season’s match in Udine, where racist chants were directed at Maignan. That game was suspended for five minutes, and the French player temporarily left the field. arts.ttl: Runjaic: ‘I have some doubts over the disallowed Udinese goal’
arts.sum: Udinese manager Kosta Runjaic shared his thoughts following his team’s narrow 1-0 defeat to AC Milan in Serie A. Speaking to DAZN after the match, Runjaic addressed several key points, including the controversial disallowed goal and his team’s overall performance. Regarding the disallowed goal scored by Kabasele, Runjaic expressed some uncertainty: “I have some doubts only about the incident of Kabasele’s disallowed goal, but I’m not a referee, I’m a coach. The responsibility for the decision lies with the referee. There’s no point in discussing this now. It’s gone that way.” When asked about his satisfaction with the team’s performance, The post Runjaic: ‘I have some doubts over the disallowed Udinese goal’ appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Milan’s Fonseca praises team spirit in hard-fought victory against Udinese
arts.sum: AC Milan manager Paulo Fonseca expressed his satisfaction with his team’s performance following their 1-0 victory over Udinese in Serie A. The match, decided by Chukwueze’s first-half goal, saw Milan play with ten men for most of the game after Reijnders’ early dismissal. In his post-match interview with DAZN, Fonseca divided the game into two parts: “The match can be split in two. We had 30 minutes of quality in the first half. After the red card, it was a game decided by our team’s spirit: it was a demonstration of unity, we worked together.” The Portuguese coach was particularly The post Milan’s Fonseca praises team spirit in hard-fought victory against Udinese appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Much-changed Milan holds on with 10 men to beat Udinese 1-0
arts.sum: Milan lost at Fiorentina 2-1 before the international break in a match in which Hernández and Abraham had penalty kicks saved. Fortunately for Milan, Samuel Chukwueze earned the lead in the 13th minute following yet another assist by Christian Pulisic.
